com.percussion.services.publisher
Interface IPSPublisherService

All Superinterfaces:
IPSCataloger
public interface IPSPublisherService
extends IPSCataloger

Service to do CRUD operations on content lists and run content lists.s

Author:
dougrand

Method Detail

createContentList

IPSContentList createContentList(String name)
Create a content list object with the given name. A GUID will be assigned, but the returned instance will be transient until saveContentLists(List) has been called.

Parameters:
name - the name, must be unique when the instance is saved, never null or empty
Returns:
a new instance, never null

loadContentLists

List<IPSContentList> loadContentLists(List<IPSGuid> ids)
                                      throws PSPublisherException
Load the content lists specified by the IDs

Parameters:
ids - a list of GUIDs, never null or empty
Returns:
a corresponding list of instances, never null or empty. Instances that are not in the database will be returned as null elements in the list.
Throws:
PSPublisherException - if there is a database error

loadContentList

IPSContentList loadContentList(IPSGuid id)
Load the content list specified by the ID. The returned object should be treated as an immutable object and may not be saved by calling saveContentList(IPSContentList).

Parameters:
id - a GUID of the content list, never null.
Returns:
the Content List instance, never null.
Throws:
com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException - if cannot find the specified Content List.

Parameters:

Returns:
the Content List instance, never null.
Throws:
com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException - if cannot find the specified Content List.

List<IPSContentList> findAllContentLists(String filter)
Get all the content lists, sorted by the passed criteria

Parameters:
filter - a name filter, only content lists with names that include the given string will be returned. Equivalent to %filter% in SQL. never null but can be empty.
Returns:
a list of content lists, might be empty, but never null

findEditionsBySiteAndContentListGenerator

List<IPSGuid> findEditionsBySiteAndContentListGenerator(IPSGuid siteId,
                                                        String clistGenerator)
                                                        throws PSPublisherException
Finds all editions in the specified site that have exactly 1 content list whose generator matches the supplied name.

Parameters:
siteId - Never null.
clistGenerator - The name of a generator used by content lists. Never blank. Generally, the fully qualified extension name, e.g. Java/global/percussion/system/sys_SelectedItemsGenerator.
Returns:
Ids of all the editions that match the criteria.
Throws:
PSPublisherException - If any problems with the DB.

executeContentList

List<PSContentListItem> executeContentList(IPSContentList list,
                                           Map<String,String> overrides,
                                           boolean publish,
                                           int deliveryContext)
                                           throws PSPublisherException
Deprecated. use executeContentList(IPSContentList, Map, boolean, IPSGuid, IPSGuid) instead.

Run the content list

Parameters:
list - the content list to run, never null
overrides - a set of override parameters to apply, never null. It must contain IPSHtmlParameters#SYS_SITEID parameter as the ID of the publishing Site.
publish - if true the content list is setup for publishing content, if false the content list is setup using existing published locations for the items in order to unpublish correctly
deliveryContext - the context of the delivery
Returns:
a list of zero or more content list items corresponding to the content list at the moment the method is called.
Throws:
PSPublisherException - if there is a database or other problem running the content list.

executeContentList

List<PSContentListItem> executeContentList(IPSContentList list,
                                           Map<String,String> overrides,
                                           boolean publish,
                                           IPSGuid deliveryContextId,
                                           IPSGuid siteId)
                                           throws PSPublisherException
Run the content list

Parameters:
list - the content list to run, never null
overrides - a set of override parameters to apply, it may be null. If it is not null, the parameter of IPSHtmlParameters#SYS_SITEID will be overridden by the given site ID, and the parameter of IPSHtmlParameters#SYS_CONTEXT will be overridden by the given delivery context ID.
publish - if true the content list is setup for publishing content, if false the content list is setup using existing published locations for the items in order to unpublish correctly
deliveryContextId - the ID of the delivery context, never null.
siteId - the ID of the publishing site, never null.
Returns:
a list of zero or more content list items corresponding to the content list at the moment the method is called.
Throws:
PSPublisherException - if there is a database or other problem running the content list.

constructAssemblyUrl

String constructAssemblyUrl(String host,
                            int port,
                            String protocol,
                            IPSGuid siteguid,
                            IPSGuid contentid,
                            IPSGuid folderguid,
                            IPSAssemblyTemplate template,
                            IPSItemFilter filter,
                            int context,
                            boolean publish)
Create an assembly url appropriate to the passed parameters. Used by the content list generator, but available for other services.

Parameters:
host - the host name or ip, may be null, defaults to the server's ip address
port - the host port, may be 0 which defaults to the server's http port
protocol - either the value http or https, may be null, defaults to http.
siteguid - the guid of the site used in assembly, may be null
contentid - a guid that references the particular content item, never null, should reference a specific item
folderguid - a guid that references the folder of the item to be assembled, may be null
template - the template to be used in assembly, never null
filter - the item filter for use with assembly, never null
context - the content for the assembly
publish - passes whether this is a publish (true) or unpublish (false)
Returns:
a fully qualified url, never null or empty

executeDemandPublish

boolean executeDemandPublish(String[] ids,
                             String parentFolderId,
                             String edition,
                             boolean wait)
Deprecated. use the business publisher instead

Process a demand publish run. This happens when a user right clicks on a group of items or folders, or during a preview. The ids are stored internally to the service and may be retrieved by calling getDemandPublishIds(int). The ids remain valid until the edition has finished running.

Parameters:
ids - an array of content ids to publish. These may be references to folders, content items or a mix. Never null or empty.
parentFolderId - the parent folder id, used for reference in creating the content list for items, not important when folders are selected, never null or empty.
edition - the edition id as a string, never null or empty
wait - if true then this method will not return until publishing is complete
Returns:
true if the demand publish succeeds, false otherwise

getCurrentContentListItemCount

int getCurrentContentListItemCount(String editionid)
Deprecated. this has been disabled, and is no longer relevant, use the business publisher for publishing job manipulation.

Fetch the last content list's content item element count. This method will block until the first content list has been fetched. After the first content list has been fetch, this method will return immediately with the most recent content list's count. It is primarily meant for demand publishing.

Parameters:
editionid - the edition, never null or empty
Returns:
the count of contentitem elements in the content list or 0 if there is a problem such as a timeout waiting for the information.

getDemandPublishIds

int[] getDemandPublishIds(int edition)
Deprecated. use the business publisher instead

Retrieve ids stored by a previous call to executeDemandPublish(String[], String, String, boolean).

Parameters:
edition - the edition that is being published
Returns:
an array of ids, null if the edition is not known

getDemandFolderId

int getDemandFolderId(int edition)
Deprecated. use the business publisher instead

Retrieve folder id stored by a previous call to executeDemandPublish(String[], String, String, boolean). Valid until the edition has been run.

Parameters:
edition - the edition that is being published
Returns:
a single folder id

executePublish

PSPublisherHandlerResponse executePublish(String editionid,
                                          String cmsUserid,
                                          String cmsPassword,
                                          String sessionid,
                                          String protocol)
Deprecated. this has been disabled, use the business publisher instead

Publish a specified edition. If the edition is already being published this method will return an error status.

Parameters:
editionid - the editionid to publish, must be numeric, never null or empty
cmsUserid - an optional user id
cmsPassword - an optional password
sessionid - the session id from the request
protocol - the protocol to use, either http or https
Returns:
the response object, will be error status if edition is currently publishing

Returns:
the status of the stop request

loadEdition

IPSEdition loadEdition(IPSGuid editionId)
                       throws com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException
Load the requested Edition, using cached copy if possible. This is a fast call, but will return a shared instance that must not be modified. The returned object is a complete tree that includes all aggregated objects, if any.

If you need to modify the returned object, you must call loadEditionModifiable(IPSGuid) instead for that object.

Parameters:
editionId - the edition id, never null.
Returns:
the referenced edition, never null.
Throws:
com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException - if the Edition does not exist.

IPSEdition loadEditionModifiable(IPSGuid id)
                                 throws com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException
This method is used to load an Edition if it needs to be modified.

Parameters:
id - the Edition id, never null.
Returns:
the Edition object, never null.
Throws:
com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException - if the Edition does not exist.

updatePublishingInfo

void updatePublishingInfo(List<com.percussion.rx.publisher.IPSPublisherItemStatus> stati)
Update the publishing information given the data in the status object. The status of the same Content Item may be updated more than ones. However, the Content-ID must exist when it is saved at the 1st time.

Parameters:
stati - a list of status objects, never null or empty. Any status items that are not in a persistable state (see IPSPublisherJobStatus.ItemState#isPersistable) ignored with a warning message.

initPublishingStatus

void initPublishingStatus(long statusid,
                          Date start,
                          IPSGuid edition)
This method is called at the start of a publishing run. It saves the status record, which is used to gather all the publication records for individual items. The initial record has the start time and edition. A later call to finishedPublishingStatus(long, Date, IPSPubStatus.EndingState) will store the end time in the database for the status, as well as any other calculations we need to do at the end of the publishing run.

Parameters:
statusid - the status id, must be unique.
start - the start time and date for the edition run, never null.
edition - the edition guid, never null.

finishedPublishingStatus

void finishedPublishingStatus(long statusid,
                              Date end,
                              IPSPubStatus.EndingState endingStatus)
This method is called at the end of a publishing run. It updates the status record with the end time, as well as any other processing needed at the end of the publishing run.

Parameters:
statusid - the status id
end - the end time and date for when the edition completed.
endingStatus - the ending status of the publishing job. Never null.

saveDeliveryType

void saveDeliveryType(IPSDeliveryType deliveryType)
Save the given delivery type. If the delivery type already exists then it updates the given delivery type.

Parameters:
deliveryType - the delivery type to save, never null.

deleteDeliveryType

void deleteDeliveryType(IPSDeliveryType deliveryType)
Delete the given deliver type. If the delivery type doesn't exist then this method will do nothing.

Parameters:
deliveryType - the delivery type to delete, never null.

createDeliveryType

IPSDeliveryType createDeliveryType()
Create a new, un-persisted delivery type.

Returns:
a new delivery location, never null.

findAllEditionsBySite

List<IPSEdition> findAllEditionsBySite(IPSGuid siteId)
Find all editions associated with the given site.

Parameters:
siteId - the ID of the site to filter editions on, never null.
Returns:
a list of editions, may be empty but never null.

findAllEditions

List<IPSEdition> findAllEditions(String filter)
Get all the editions, sorted by the passed criteria

Parameters:
filter - a name filter, only content lists with names that include the given string will be returned. Equivalent to %filter% in SQL with case-insensitive. never null but can be empty.
Returns:
a list of content lists, might be empty, but never null
Throws:
PSPublisherException - if there is a database problem

findAllContentListsBySite

List<IPSContentList> findAllContentListsBySite(IPSGuid siteId)
Find all content lists associated with the given site. Content lists are associated with a site by benefit of being used in one or more editions in the site.

Parameters:
siteId - the site ID to filter content lists on, never null.
Returns:
a list of content lists, may be empty but never null.

saveEdition

void saveEdition(IPSEdition edition)
Save the given edition. If the edition already exists then update the edition in the database. . Save the supplied Edition to persistent storage. Associated tasks must be saved separately. The Edition must have been created using loadEditionModifiable(IPSGuid) or createEdition(). If the object is found in the cache, an exception is thrown.

Note to implementers: if the object is found in the cache (use ==), that object must be flushed from the cache.

Parameters:
edition - the edition to save, never null.

deleteEdition

void deleteEdition(IPSEdition edition)
Delete the given edition. If the edition doesn't exist then this method does nothing. Deleting an edition will delete the associated tasks.

Parameters:
edition - the edition to delete, never null.

createEditionTask

IPSEditionTaskDef createEditionTask()
Create a new uninitialized edition task. The task will have an assigned task id, but will not be persisted until saved.

Returns:
the new edition task, never null.

findEditionTaskById

IPSEditionTaskDef findEditionTaskById(IPSGuid id)
Find an edition task from the database. It will be more usual to load tasks using loadEditionTasks(IPSGuid).

Parameters:
id - the id of the task to load.
Returns:
the task data or null if the task data isn't found.

saveEditionTask

void saveEditionTask(IPSEditionTaskDef task)
Save an edition task. The save method will assign ids to the task and parameters as required. Empty parameters will be removed.

Parameters:
task - the task to save, never null.

deleteEditionTask

void deleteEditionTask(IPSEditionTaskDef task)
Delete an edition task and it's associated parameters.

Parameters:
task - the task to delete, never null.

loadEditionTasks

List<IPSEditionTaskDef> loadEditionTasks(IPSGuid editionid)
Load the edition tasks that are associated with the given edition.

Parameters:
editionid - the GUID of the edition, never null.
Returns:
the edition task list, never null but could be empty. It is (ascending) ordered by the sequence property of task, see IPSEditionTaskDef.getSequence().

createEdition

IPSEdition createEdition()
Create a new edition instance. A GUID will be assigned, but the instance will otherwise be uninitialized. Note that the instance will be transient until it is saved.

Returns:
the new uninitialized edition, never null.

createEditionTaskLog

IPSEditionTaskLog createEditionTaskLog()
Create a new edition log entry. Log entries are used to record the running of edition tasks.

Returns:
a newly created instance, which will have the reference id set, never null.

findEditionTaskLogEntriesByJobId

List<IPSEditionTaskLog> findEditionTaskLogEntriesByJobId(long jobid)
Find the entries for a given job id.

Parameters:
jobid - the job id
Returns:
the ordered list of entries, with reference ids in an increasing order.

saveEditionTaskLog

void saveEditionTaskLog(IPSEditionTaskLog log)
Save or update the given log object.

Parameters:
log - the object to save, never null.

loadEditionTaskLog

IPSEditionTaskLog loadEditionTaskLog(long referenceId)
Load the given entry.

Parameters:
referenceId - the entry to load, never null.
Returns:
the entry, or null if the entry does not exist.

purgeJobLog

void purgeJobLog(long jobid)
Remove records from the status, task and document logs that belong to the given job id. Records in the document log that are used by PSX_SITE_ITEM will be kept, but the job id will be removed. Records that have no job id, i.e. it is null, and have no reference from the site items will be removed, not just the records associated with the jobid.

Parameters:
jobid - the job id to purge jobs for

cancelUnfinishedJobItems

void cancelUnfinishedJobItems(long jobId)
Sets the status of the job items to IPSSiteItem.Status.CANCELLED for the items that are neither in IPSSiteItem.Status.SUCCESS or IPSSiteItem.Status.FAILURE status.

Parameters:
jobId - the ID of the cancelled job.

findExpiredJobs

List<Long> findExpiredJobs(Date beforeDate)
Find jobs that were executed before the given date. This is used in conjunction with purgeJobLog(long) to remove old pub logs from the database.

Parameters:
beforeDate - the criteria date, never null.
Returns:
a list of the jobs from before the given date as determined from the status table.

findRefIdForJob

List<Long> findRefIdForJob(long jobid,
                           List<org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.SortCriterion> sort)
Finds the reference IDs for the given job. The order of the returned IDs is defined by the the parameter of sorts. order

Parameters:
jobid - the job ID.
sorts - the sort criteria that determines the order of the returned reference IDs.
Returns:
the reference IDs for the supplied publishing job. It may be null or empty if not found.

findPubItemStatusForJob

List<IPSPubItemStatus> findPubItemStatusForJob(long jobid)
Get the item status for the job in a block. This is used for edition tasks that wish to know the status information for the edition. For example, a post task might want to move published files across a number of destination servers, this information could tell such a task what items were published successfully and where they were published.

Parameters:
jobid - the job id
Returns:
a list of results, never null but could be empty if the job id does not correspond to any results.

findPubStatusByEdition

List<IPSPubStatus> findPubStatusByEdition(IPSGuid edition)
Find and return all the completed job information for a given edition.

Parameters:
edition - the edition guid, never null.
Returns:
a list of prior job status data in descending start date order, but could be empty.

findPubStatusBySite

List<IPSPubStatus> findPubStatusBySite(IPSGuid siteId)
Find and return all the completed job information for a given site.

Parameters:
site - the ID of the site, never null.
Returns:
a list of prior job status data in descending start date order, but could be empty.

findAllPubStatus

List<IPSPubStatus> findAllPubStatus()
Find and return all the completed job information for all sites.

Returns:
a list of prior job status data in descending start date order, but could be empty.

deleteSiteItems

void deleteSiteItems(IPSGuid siteguid)
Remove all site items for the given site. This will also clear any dependencies between the site items and publications log.

Parameters:
siteguid - the guid of the site, never null

findReferenceIdsToUnpublish

List<Long> findReferenceIdsToUnpublish(IPSGuid siteId,
                                       String unpublishFlags)
Find what known site items, identified by reference id, should be unpublished. Items are selected if:
  • The content is no longer in the system.
  • The content is no longer in the published folder.
  • The content is now in an archive state as configured for the system.

Parameters:
siteId - the ID of the site, never null.
unpublishFlags - the unpublishing flags. It is one or more characters corresponding to content valid flags used in the workflow, multiples should be separated by commas. Never null or empty.
Returns:
a list of IDs to unpublish, may be empty but not null.

findPubItemStatusForReferenceIds

List<IPSPubItemStatus> findPubItemStatusForReferenceIds(List<Long> refs)
Find the status records for the given reference ids.

Parameters:
refs - the reference ids, never null.
Returns:
the status records, never null.

findSiteItemsForReferenceIds

List<com.percussion.services.publisher.data.PSSiteItem> findSiteItemsForReferenceIds(List<Long> refs)
Find the site items for the given reference ids.

Parameters:
refs - the reference ids, never null.
Returns:
the site item records, never null.

findUnpublishInfoForAssemblyItem

Object[] findUnpublishInfoForAssemblyItem(IPSGuid contentId,
                                          IPSGuid contextId,
                                          IPSGuid templateId,
                                          IPSGuid siteId,
                                          String targetPath)
Find the unpublishing data corresponding to the given parameters of an assembly item. Used specifically for legacy content lists doing unpublishing. We must use the location specified to lookup the data since the folder is not (necessarily) supplied.

Parameters:
contentId - the content ID, never null.
contextId - the delivery context ID.
templateId - the template ID, never null.
siteId - the site ID, never null.
targetPath - the target path when the item was originally published, or null if there wasn't one (e.g. for DB publish). Note, this was returned from the location generator, which is relative to the publish root of the site.
Returns:
the info, or null if the information cannot be determined. The first element in the information is the delivery type name, the second is the reference ID and the third is the unpublishing info as a byte[] array. The unpublishing information may be null. The fourth element is the folder id set by the published item.

findAllUnusedContentLists

List<IPSContentList> findAllUnusedContentLists()
Find all the content lists that are not associated with some edition in some site.

Returns:
the list of such content lists, may be empty but not null.
